reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lobby has been updated to have more of a modern feel but past that the property is in need of a makeover. Rooms are quite small and a little on the musty side, the shower pressure is very poor and soundproofing is non-existent. We were kept awake all night due to our ‘neighbours’ snoring and the next guests that moved in knew we were from Australia because they could hear us on a telephone call. There are no fridges in the rooms which makes it hard to keep any food. There is also no air-conditioning, which wasn’t a problem for us as we were there in winter but I would imaging the rooms would get hot during summer.
reviews.title: Bearable but glad to leave

likes.liked: — You get what you paid for.
likes.disliked: — Poor shower pressure and non-existent sound proofing!

reviews.text: There is a Metro station about 3 blocks away from the hotel but as first timers to Mexico City we didn’t find the location was all that suitable to tourists, the hotel is situated on a street of electrical shops – if you need a remote control, a TV or a memory card you are set, however, if you are after food, a laundry or anything else you will have to venture further. We arrived late afternoon and didn’t feel safe to go exploring in the dark so we had dinner in the hotel, the food is below average and slow to arrive but the restaurant staff are real characters.
reviews.title: good hotel and good deal

reviews.text: Once we were more familiar with the area we explored a little further and found some decent restaurants and shops, having said that ,we tried to be off the streets and back in the hotel by 9pm. I believe Zona Rosa is a better option if you want to feel more at ease.
reviews.title: Convinient and clean

likes.disliked: — Chairs in the bar were uncomfortable!

reviews.title: A great & cheap find!
reviews.text: Some reception staff were helpful, others didn’t want to know you or tell you anything. For example, we learn’t on our last day that if you put down a refundable deposit they gave you a remote control to enable the cable service on the television – which means you receive English speaking channels. They have 3 computers with very reasonably priced internet access available for guests, there was a number of times we wanted to use them and they weren’t working, but the problems were normally rectified in under an hour.
